solution.text:
Over a total of 4 games john scores 5 goals.
Next two he scores none. Hence, ratio of goals to games = 5:6
Total number of games in the season = _{{6*j}}_
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, Number of goals scored in the season = Ratio of goals to games * total number of games = (5/6) x _{{6*j}}_ = _{{5*j}}_

content.text: John scores 5 goals in 4 games. Then in the next two games he fails to score any goals.The following trend continues throughout the season where there are _{{6*j}}_ games. How many goals does John score in the season?
